song "Not Listening" by [[Papa Roach]] was included in the trailer but never in the soundtrack. ==''Resident Evil: Apocalypse'' (Score)== {{Infobox album | Name = Resident Evil: Apocalypse Original Motion Picture Music | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[Jeff Danna]] | Cover = | Released = 2004 | Recorded = 2004 | Genre = [[Soundtrack]] | Length = 38:59 | Label = Roadrunner | Producer = [[Jeff Danna]] | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Soundtrack.net]] |rev1score = {{Rating|2.5|5}}{{cite web |url=http://www.soundtrack.net/albums/database/?id=3582 |title=Resident Evil: Apocalypse (Score) Soundtrack |work=[[Soundtrack.net]] |accessdate=4 April 2010}} }} '''''Resident Evil: Apocalypse â Original Motion Picture Music''''' features score cues composed by [[Jeff Danna]] for the film and performed by the [[London Philharmonia Orchestra]]. It has an emphasis on orchestral sound in sharp contrast to the electronic sound utilized by [[Marco Beltrami]] and [[Marilyn Manson (band)|Marilyn Manson]] in the original [[Resident Evil (film)|Resident Evil]] film score. This additional release is differentiated by the words "Music Composed by Jeff Danna" on the lower right front of the cover art. {{Track listing | headline = Track listing{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/r712291 |title=Resident Evil: Apocalypse [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack] - Jeff Danna |work=[[Allmusic]] |accessdate=2010-04-04}} | total_length = 38:59 | title1 = My Name Is Alice |length1 = 2:13 | title2 = Alice Battles the Nemesis |length2 = 3:04 | title3 = The Nemesis vs. S.T.A.R.S. |length3 = 2:11 | title4 = Panic at the Gate |length4 = 1:37 | title5 = Umbrella is Watching |length5 = 3:01 | title6 = Ashford's Plan |length6 = 2:36 | title7 = Cain's Demise |length7 = 1:52 | title8 = The Nemesis is Awakened |length8 = 2:44 | title9 = Zombies in Church |length9 = 1:34 | title10 = Captured by Umbrella |length10 = 2:22 | title11 = The Crash Site |length11 = 1:03 | title12 = Dogs in the Kitchen |length12 = 2:03 | title13 = Searching for Alice |length13 = 2:43 | title14 = The Anti-Virus |length14 = 2:14 | title15 = Beneath the City |length15 = 2:18 | title16 = The Last Transport |length16 = 1:54 | title17 = Search the School |length17 = 1:30 | title18 = I Remember Everything |length18 = 2:04 }} ==''Resident Evil: Extinction''== {{Infobox album | Name = Resident Evil: Extinction; Original Motion Picture Soundtrack | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[Various Artists]] | Cover = | Released = September 18, 2007 | Genre = [[Alternative rock]]
[[Alternative metal]]
[[Hardcore punk]]/[[Metalcore]]
[[Symphonic metal]]
[[Industrial metal]]
[[Gothic rock]]
[[Soundtrack]] | | Length = 1:00:00 | Label = [[Lakeshore Records|Lakeshore]] | Producer = }} The Original Motion Picture Soundtrack's [[myspace]] page for the film opened on the August 14. The album was released on the September 18. A special edition featuring 3 bonus tracks was released internationally on the October 15, 2007 through Bodog Records. The Music Supervisor [[Branden Steineckert]], drummer for punk band [[Rancid (band)|Rancid]], announced the current tracklisting for the film and has the main theme available to stream at the [http://www.myspace.com/residentevilsoundtrack myspace page] and at [http://www.mp3.com/artist/resident-evil3a-extinction-/summary mp3.com]. The score was composed by [[Charlie Clouser]]. The track listing is as follows:{{cite news |last=D. |first=Spence |title=Resident Evil: Extinction Original Motion Picture Soundtrack |work=IGN.com |date=2007-09-21 |url=http://music.ign.com/articles/821/821929p2.html |accessdate=2007-11-18}} {{Track listing | headline = Track listing | writing_credits = yes | title1 = Main Title | note1 = Score | writer1 = [[Charlie Clouser]] | length1 = 0:49 | title2 = Stupid Crazy | writer2 = [[Shadows Fall]] | length2 = 4:40 | title3 = [[I'm So Sick]] | note3 = T-Virus remix | writer3 = [[Flyleaf]] Vs. [[Legion of Doom (mash up group)|Legion of Doom]] | length3 = 3:21 | title4 = [[My World (Emigrate song)|My World]] | writer4 = [[Emigrate]] | length4 = 4:17 | title5 = Duality | note5 = Project Alice String remix | writer5 = [[Bayside (band)|Bayside]] | length5 = 3:01 | title6 = Losing | note6 = Score | writer6 = [[Charlie Clouser]] | length6 = 1:19 | title7 = [[One Love (Aiden song)|One Love]] | note7 = Extinction Remix | writer7 = [[Aiden]] Vs. [[Legion of Doom (mash up group)|Legion of Doom]] | length7 = 4:01 | title8 = Deathcar | writer8 = [[Fightstar]] | length8 = 3:58 | title9 = I, Suicide | writer9 = [[Throwdown (band)|Throwdown]] | length9 = 3:36 | title10 = [[White Rabbit (song)|White Rabbit]] | note10 = [[SPC ECO]] Mix | writer10 = [[Collide (band)|Collide]] | length10 = 4:42 | title11 = Paralyzed | writer11 = [[Chimaira]] | length11 = 3:07 | title12 = Laser Tunnel | note12 = Score | writer12 = [[Charlie Clouser]] | length12 = 0:27 | title13 = Asleep on the Frontlines | note13 = Appliantz Remix | writer13 = [[The Bled]] | length13 = 5:33 | title14 = Catch Me | writer14 = [[City Sleeps]] | length14 = 3:21 | title15 = Contagious | writer15 = [[Searchlight]] | length15 = 4:18 | title16 = Scenotaph | note16 = DJA Infected remix | writer16 = [[Emanuel (band)|Emanuel]] | length16 = 4:16 | title17 = Sixth of June | writer17 = [[It Dies Today]] | length17 = 3:04 | title18 = Wrecking Itself Taking You with Me | writer18 = [[Poison the Well (band)|Poison the Well]] | length18 = 3:21 | title19 = Convoy | note19 = Score | writer19 = [[Charlie Clouser]] | length19 = 0:43 | title20 = Devils In the Mist | note20 = European Bonus tracks released by Bodog records | writer20 = [[Overkill (band)|Overkill]] | length20 = ? | title21 = So Many People | writer21 = [[Neurosonic]] | length21 = ? | title22 = [[Amaranth (song)|Amaranth]] | writer22 = [[Nightwish]] | length22 = 3:51 | note22 = European Bonus tracks released by Bodog records | title23 = [[Last Angel]] | writer23 = [[Kumi Koda]] ft. [[TVXQ]] | length23 = ? | note23 = Japanese Bonus track released by [[Avex Trax]] }} * On August 1, 2007 Rock band [[Emigrate]] announced and premiered their video "My World" which is, "one of the lead tracks of the ''Resident Evil: Extinction'' soundtrack" according to their website. The video can be viewed [http://www.emigrate.eu/Video here]. * It has also been confirmed that J-Pop singer, [[Koda Kumi]], will be singing a duet with the Korean boy band [[TVXQ]] called "Last Angel" for the Japanese release of the movie. * TV Spots for the DVD release of the movie featured the song "I Know It's You" by [[The Crystal Method]]. The song features singing by Milla Jovovich, the lead role in the series. However, the song was produced and released before the second movie in the series was out in theaters. * The song "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" by [[Iron Butterfly]] is in the movie and mentioned in the movie credits although is not in the track list. ==''Resident Evil: Extinction'' (Score)== {{Infobox album | Name = Resident Evil: Extinction â Score | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[Charlie Clouser]] | Cover = | Released = December 18, 2007 | Genre = [[Soundtrack]] | Length = 1:04:13 | Label = Lakeshore | Producer = }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = Soundtrack.net |rev1score = {{Rating|3|5}}{{cite web |url=http://www.soundtrack.net/albums/database/?id=4732 |title=Resident Evil: Extinction (Score) Soundtrack |work=Soundtrack.net |accessdate=2007-12-17}} }} '''''Resident Evil: Extinction â Score''''', [[Charlie Clouser]]'s score for the movie was released on December 18, 2007 under the [[Lakeshore Records]] label. The release featured the following 34 tracks: {{Track listing | headline = Track listing | total_length = 1:04:13 | title1 = Clone Awake |length1 = 0:46 | title2 = The Ditch |length2 = 1:50 | title3 = Alice Ride |length3 = 0:55 | title4 = Dog Attack |length4 = 2:17 | title5 = To the Hive |length5 = 2:35 | title6 = Flysolated |length6 = 0:55 | title7 = Convoy |length7 = 0:40 | title8 = Motel Closet |length8 = 2:26 | title9 = Dexterity |length9 = 2:01 | title10 = Perimeter Fire |length10 = 2:53 | title11 = Telepathic Sense |length11 = 1:39 | title12 = Desert Walk |length12 = 1:09 | title13 = Birds Attack |length13 = 4:46 | title14 = Choose Sides |length14 = 2:12 | title15 = Carlos Hug |length15 = 2:35 | title16 = Positive ID |length16 = 2:28 | title17 = For Alaska |length17 = 2:57 | title18 = New Orders |length18 = 2:25 | title19 = Vegas Journal |length19 = 0:42 | title20 = Container |length20 = 2:29 | title21 = Open Box |length21 = 1:49 | title22 = Losing Texan |length22 = 1:35 | title23 = To Tent |length23 = 2:00 | title24 = Tentacles |length24 = 1:22 | title25 = Carlos Plan |length25 = 2:25 | title26 = Tanker Truck |length26 = 2:48 | title27 = Others Gone |length27 = 1:06 | title28 = Elevator |length28 = 1:12 | title29 = Your Blood |length29 = 2:04 | title30 = Clone Bubble |length30 = 1:23 | title31 = Alice Pic |length31 = 0:45 | title32 = Isaacs Dead |length32 = 2:45 | title33 = Laser Tunnel |length33 = 0:25 | title34 = New Headquarters |length34 = 1:54 }} ==''Resident Evil: Afterlife''== {{Infobox album | Name = Resident Evil: Afterlife (Music from the Motion Picture) | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[tomandandy]] | Cover = Resident Evil Afterlife Soundtrack.jpg | Released = September 13, 2010 | Genre = [[Soundtrack]] | Length = 1:04:13 | Label = Milan | Producer = }} '''''Resident Evil: Afterlife''''' is the fourth score released for the film franchise, composed by the [[transmedia]] group [[tomandandy]]. The score was released via [[iTunes]] September 13, 2010 and on a physical disc September 27, 2010.http://ultimate-re.com/index.php?subaction=showfull&id=1283217132&archive=&start_from=&ucat=& {{Track listing | headline = Track listing | total_length = 1:04:13 | title1 = Tokyo |length1 = 4:32 | title2 = Umbrella |length2 = 1:20 | title3 = Damage |length3 = 1:02 | title4 = Cutting |length4 = 1:12 | title5 = Twins |length5 = 1:47 | title6 = Exit |length6 = 0:47 | title7 = Far |length7 = 1:07 | title8 = Flying |length8 = 1:58 | title9 = Memory |length9 = 3:17 | title10 = Los Angeles |length10 = 2:09 | title11 = Binoculars |length11 = 2:53 | title12 = Prison |length12 = 1:58 | title13 = Discovery |length13 = 1:10 | title14 = Hatchet |length14 = 1:23 | title15 = AxeMan |length15 = 3:07 | title16 = Arcadia |length16 = 4:21 | title17 = Up |length17 = 1:39 | title18 = Party |length18 = 0:54 | title19 = Promise |length19 = 2:12 | title20 = Resident Evil Suite |length20 = 4:33 }} * The [[Danny Lohner|RenholdÃ«r]] Apocalypse Mix of [[A Perfect Circle]]'s "[[The Outsider (A Perfect Circle song)|The Outsider]]" is featured in both theatrical trailers and TV Spots for the film and is featured during the confrontation with Albert Wesker and the ending of the film. * "Zombie" by the electronic/rock band [[The Trucks]] is featured in an [[UGO Networks|UGO.com]]-exclusive TV Spot for the film.http://community.livejournal.com/residentevilmov/101926.html ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Resident Evil series}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:Discography of the ''Resident Evil'' film series}} [[Category:Film soundtracks]] [[Category:2002 soundtracks]] [[Category:2004 soundtracks]] [[Category:2007 soundtracks]] [[fa:ÙÙØ³ÛÙÛ ÙØªÙ Ø³Ø±Û ÙÛÙÙâÙØ§Û Ø±Ø²ÛØ¯ÙØª Ø§ÛÙÙ]] [[fr:Resident Evil Soundtrack]]
